Numerical Method for Partial Differential Equation

NumPDENumerical Method for Partial Differential Equation

professor : Ralf Hiptmair

author: walkerchi

Basic Mathematic

Theorem

  • Gauss’s Theorem : ∫Ωdiv j dx=∫∂Ωj⋅n dS(x)\int_\Omega \text{div}~\textbf{j}~\text{d}x = \int_{\partial \Omega}\textbf{j}\cdot\textbf{n}~\text{d}S(x)∫Ω​div j dx=∫∂Ω​j⋅n dS(x)
  • Green’s first formula : ∫Ωj⋅ v dx=−∫Ω∇⋅ j v dx+∫∂Ωj⋅n v dS\int_{\Omega}\textbf{j}\cdot\ v~\text{d}x = - \int_{\Omega}\nabla \cdot ~\textbf{j}~v~\text{d}x +\int_{\partial \Omega}\textbf{j}\cdot \textbf{n}~v~\text{d}S∫Ω​j⋅ v dx=−∫Ω​∇⋅ j v dx+∫∂Ω​j⋅n v dS
  • General product rule : div(j v)=v divj+j⋅∇v\text{div}(\textbf{j}~v) = v~\text{div}\textbf{j} + \textbf{j}\cdot \nabla vdiv(j v)=v divj+j⋅∇v

Notation

  • n:∂Ω→Rd\textbf{n} : \partial\Omega \to \R^dn:∂Ω→Rd exterior unit normal vector field on ∂Ω\partial \Omega∂Ω
  • j∈Rd\textbf j\in \R^dj∈Rd : flux vector, e.g. velocity field
  • Ω\OmegaΩ : interior domain
  • ∂Ω\partial \Omega∂Ω : domain boundary

Definition

  • inf{x}∈Rd\text{inf}\{x\}\in \R^dinf{x}∈Rd : infinite set , the lower bound
  • sup{x}∈Rd\text{sup}\{x\} \in \R^dsup{x}∈Rd : super set, the upper bound

Sobolev Space & Norm

  • L2L^2L2 norm : ∥v∥L2=∫Ω∥v(x)∥2dx\Vert v\Vert_{L^2} = \sqrt{\int_\Omega \Vert v(x) \Vert^2 dx}∥v∥L2​=∫Ω​∥v(x)∥2dx​

    • Cpw0(Ω)⊂L2(Ω)C_{pw}^0(\Omega) \subset L^2(\Omega)Cpw0​(Ω)⊂L2(Ω)

  • H1(Ω)H^1(\Omega)H1(Ω) seminorm : ∣v∣H1=∫Ω∥∇v∥2dx=∥∇v∥L2\vert v\vert_{H^1} = \sqrt{\int_{\Omega}\Vert\nabla v\Vert^2 dx} = \Vert \nabla v\Vert _{L^2}∣v∣H1​=∫Ω​∥∇v∥2dx​=∥∇v∥L2​

    • H01(Ω)H^1_0(\Omega)H01​(Ω) denotes the boundary ∂Ω\partial \Omega∂Ω is 000
    • Cpw0(Ω)⊄H1(Ω)Cpw1(Ω)⊂H1(Ω)C_{pw}^0(\Omega)\not\subset H^1(\Omega) \quad C_{pw}^1(\Omega)\subset H^1(\Omega)Cpw0​(Ω)⊂H1(Ω)Cpw1​(Ω)⊂H1(Ω)

  • H1(Ω)H^1(\Omega)H1(Ω) norm : ∥v∥H1=∥v∥L22+∣v∣H12\Vert v\Vert_{H^1} = \sqrt{\Vert v\Vert_{L^2}^2 + \vert v\vert_{H^1}^2}∥v∥H1​=∥v∥L22​+∣v∣H12​​

    • Multiplicative trace inequality : ∥u∥L2(∂Ω)2≤C∥u∥L2(Ω)⋅∥u∥H1(Ω)∃C=C(Ω)>0\Vert u \Vert^2 _{L^2 (\partial \Omega)} \le C\Vert u\Vert_{L^2(\Omega)} \cdot \Vert u\Vert_{H^1(\Omega)}\quad \exists C = C(\Omega) > 0∥u∥L2(∂Ω)2​≤C∥u∥L2(Ω)​⋅∥u∥H1(Ω)​∃C=C(Ω)>0

  • Hm(Ω)H^m(\Omega)Hm(Ω) norm : ∥v∥Hm=∑α∈Nd,∣α∣=m∫Ω∣Dαu∣2dx\Vert v\Vert_{H^m} = \underset{\boldsymbol \alpha \in \N^d,|\boldsymbol \alpha|=m}{\sum}\int_\Omega \vert \text{D}^{\boldsymbol\alpha} u\vert^2\text d\boldsymbol x∥v∥Hm​=α∈Nd,∣α∣=m∑​∫Ω​∣Dαu∣2dx

  • ∥⋅∥a\Vert\cdot\Vert_{\text a}∥⋅∥a​ energy norm : ∥v∥a=a(v,v)\Vert v\Vert_{\text a}=\sqrt{a(v,v)}∥v∥a​=a(v,v)​

Boundary

  • Dirichelet boundary (essential boundary) : u=gu∈∂Ωu = g\quad u\in \partial \Omegau=gu∈∂Ω
  • Neumann boundary (natural boundary) : ∂u∂n=j⋅n=−hu∈∂Ω\frac{\partial u}{\partial \textbf{n}} = \textbf{j}\cdot \textbf{n}= -h\quad u\in \partial \Omega∂n∂u​=j⋅n=−hu∈∂Ω
    • compatibility condition : −∫∂Ωh dS=∫Ωfdx-\int_{\partial \Omega}h~dS = \int_{\Omega} fdx−∫∂Ω​h dS=∫Ω​fdx for the existence of Neumann problem
    • variational form example : ∫Ωκ(x)∇u⋅∇v dx+∫∂ΩΨ(u) v dS=∫Ωfv dxu∈H1(Ω)∀v∈H1(Ω)\int_\Omega \kappa(\boldsymbol x)\nabla u\cdot \nabla v~d\boldsymbol x + \int_{\partial\Omega}\Psi(u)~v~d\mathcal S = \int_{\Omega}fv~d\boldsymbol x\quad\begin{matrix}u\in H^1(\Omega)\\\forall v\in H^1(\Omega)\end{matrix}∫Ω​κ(x)∇u⋅∇v dx+∫∂Ω​Ψ(u) v dS=∫Ω​fv dxu∈H1(Ω)∀v∈H1(Ω)​
  • Radiation boundary : ∂u∂n=Ψ(u)u∈∂Ω\frac{\partial u}{\partial \textbf{n}} = \Psi(u) \quad u \in\partial \Omega∂n∂u​=Ψ(u)u∈∂Ω

Notation

  • n:∂Ω→Rd\textbf{n} : \partial\Omega \to \R^dn:∂Ω→Rd exterior unit normal vector field on ∂Ω\partial \Omega∂Ω
  • j∈Rd\textbf j\in \R^dj∈Rd : flux vector, e.g. velocity field
  • Ω\OmegaΩ : interior domain
  • ∂Ω\partial \Omega∂Ω : domain boundary

Forms

  • Minimization problem : $u = \underset{v}{\text{argmin}}~J(v) =\underset{v}{\text{argmin}}~\frac{1}{2}\text{a}(v,v) - \ell(v) =\underset{v}{\text{argmin}}~\frac{1}{2}\Vert v\Vert_\text{a} - \ell(v) $
  • LVP (Generalized) Linear variational problem : a(u,v)=ℓ(v)u∈V^0∀v∈V0\text{a}(u,v) = \ell(v) \quad \begin{matrix}u\in \hat V_0 \\ \forall v\in V_0\end{matrix}a(u,v)=ℓ(v)u∈V^0​∀v∈V0​​, V^0\hat V_0V^0​ is the trial space, V0V_0V0​ is the test space
    • example :
  • BVP Boundary value problem
  • DVP Discrete variational problem : a(uh,vh)=ℓ(vh)uh∈V0,h∀vh∈V0,h\text{a}(u_h,v_h) = \ell(v_h)\quad \begin{matrix}u_h\in V_{0,h}\\\forall v_h \in V_{0,h}\end{matrix}a(uh​,vh​)=ℓ(vh​)uh​∈V0,h​∀vh​∈V0,h​​ where uuu is test space, vvv is trial space
  • IVP Initial boundary problem : y˙=f(t,y)y(t0)=y0\dot {\textbf y} = f(t,\textbf y)\quad \textbf y(t_0)=\textbf y_0y˙​=f(t,y)y(t0​)=y0​
  • Strong form : a partial differential equation (PDE)
    • example : −∇2u=f-\nabla^2 u = f−∇2u=f
  • Weak form : add test space and integrate in domain to the strong form
    • example : −∇2u=f→∫Ω∇u⋅∇v dx−∫∂Ω∇u⋅n v dS=∫Ωf v dx-\nabla^2 u = f \to \int_\Omega \nabla u \cdot \nabla v~\text d x - \int_{\partial\Omega} \nabla u \cdot\boldsymbol n~v~\text d\mathcal S = \int_\Omega f~v~\text dx−∇2u=f→∫Ω​∇u⋅∇v dx−∫∂Ω​∇u⋅n v dS=∫Ω​f v dx

FEM Finite Element Method

Galerkin Discretization

a(uh,vh)=ℓ(vh)⇔Aμ⃗=ϕ⃗a(u_h,v_h) = \ell(v_h) \Leftrightarrow \textbf{A}\vec \mu = \vec \phi a(uh​,vh​)=ℓ(vh​)⇔Aμ​=ϕ​

Notation

  • A\textbf{A}A Galerkin matrix (stiffness matrix) : A=[a(bhk,bhj)]j,k=1N∈RN×N\textbf{A} = \left[\text{a}(b_h^k,b_h^j)\right]^N_{j,k=1}\in \R^{N\times N}A=[a(bhk​,bhj​)]j,k=1N​∈RN×N
    • A\textbf{A}A is symmetric and positive definite
  • ϕ⃗\vec \phiϕ​ : Right hand side vector (load vector) : ϕ⃗=[ℓ(bhj)]j=1N∈RN\vec \phi = \left[\ell(b_h^j)\right]_{j=1}^N\in \R^Nϕ​=[ℓ(bhj​)]j=1N​∈RN
  • μ⃗\vec \muμ​ : Coefficient vector : μ⃗=[μ1,⋯ ,μh]⊤∈RN\vec \mu =[\mu_1,\cdots,\mu_h]^\top\in\R^Nμ​=[μ1​,⋯,μh​]⊤∈RN, uh=∑k=1Nμkbhku_h = \sum_{k=1}^N\mu_kb_h^kuh​=∑k=1N​μk​bhk​ where bhk∈Bb_h^k\in\mathfrak Bbhk​∈B is basis function

Basis Function

  • degree of freedom : basis function bhk∈Bhb_h^k\in\mathfrak{B}_hbhk​∈Bh​

  • change of basis : Bh~=SBh→A~=SAS⊤ϕ⃗~=Sϕ⃗μ⃗~=S−Tμ⃗\tilde{\mathfrak{B}_h} = \textbf{S}\mathfrak{B}_h\to \tilde{\textbf{A}} = \textbf S\textbf A\textbf S^\top\quad \tilde{\vec\phi}=\textbf{S}\vec\phi\quad \tilde{\vec \mu} = S^{-T}\vec \muBh​~​=SBh​→A~=SAS⊤ϕ​~​=Sϕ​μ​~​=S−Tμ​

  • support : $\text{supp}(f) = {x\in\Omega,f(x)\neq 0} $

tent function : bhj(x)={(x−xj−1)/hjxj−1≤x≤xj(xj+1−x)/hj+1xj≤x≤xj+10otherwiseb_h^j(x) = \begin{cases}(x-x_{j-1})/h_j&x_{j-1}\le x\le x_j\\(x_{j+1}-x)/h_{j+1}&x_j\le x\le x_{j+1}\\0&\text{otherwise}\end{cases}bhj​(x)=⎩⎨⎧​(x−xj−1​)/hj​(xj+1​−x)/hj+1​0​xj−1​≤x≤xj​xj​≤x≤xj+1​otherwise​

Quadrature

∫abψ(t)dt≈∑j=1mωjmψ(ζjm)\int_a^b \psi(t)dt \approx \sum_{j=1}^m \omega_j^m \psi(\zeta_j^m) ∫ab​ψ(t)dt≈j=1∑m​ωjm​ψ(ζjm​)

Notation

  • ωjm\omega_j^mωjm​ : quadrature weights
  • ζjm\zeta_j^mζjm​ : quadrature nodes

Assemble

AK→AM∀K∈M\textbf A_{K} \to \textbf A_\mathcal M\quad \forall K\in \mathcal M AK​→AM​∀K∈M

construct the global stiffness matrix/load vector using element stiffness matrix/load vector

Stiffness Matrix

  • Edge

Aij=a(bh∣K1j,bh∣K1i)+a(bh∣K2j,bh∣K2i)∀i≠j\textbf{A}_{ij}=\text{a}\left(b_{h|K_1}^j,b_{h|K_1}^i\right)+ \text{a}\left( b_{h|K_2}^j,b_{h|K_2}^i\right) \quad \forall i\neq j Aij​=a(bh∣K1​j​,bh∣K1​i​)+a(bh∣K2​j​,bh∣K2​i​)∀i=j

  • Node

Aii=∑Kj,i∈Kja(bh∣Kji,bh∣Kji)\textbf{A}_{ii} = \sum_{K_j,i\in K_j}\text{a}\left(b_{h|K_j}^i,b_{h|K_j}^i\right) Aii​=Kj​,i∈Kj​∑​a(bh∣Kj​i​,bh∣Kj​i​)

Transformation

$$ K = \Phi_K(\hat K) = \textbf F_k \hat K+\tau \Rightarrow |K| =|\hat K| |\text{det} \textbf F_k| $$ > *Notation* > > - $K/\hat K$ : transformed/origin element > - $\Phi_K$ : transformation for element $K$, $(\Phi^*u)(x)=\Phi(u(\hat x))\Rightarrow (\nabla_{\hat x}(\Phi^* u))(\hat x) = (\text{D}\Phi(\hat x))^\top\underbrace{(\nabla_x u)\Phi(\hat x)}_{=\Phi^*(\nabla u)(\hat x)}$

To apply the transformation, following rules are used :

  • quadrature : ωℓK=det(DΦ(ζ^ℓ)⊤DΦ(ζ^ℓ))⏟Gramian determinantω^ℓζℓK=ΦK(ζ^ℓ)\omega_\ell^K = \underbrace{\sqrt{\text{det}(\text{D}\Phi(\hat \zeta_\ell)^\top \text{D}\Phi(\hat \zeta_{\ell}))}}_{\text{\textcolor{yellow}{Gramian determinant}}}\hat\omega_\ell \quad \zeta_\ell^K = \Phi_K(\hat \zeta_\ell) ωℓK​=Gramian determinantdet(DΦ(ζ^​ℓ​)⊤DΦ(ζ^​ℓ​))​​​ω^ℓ​ζℓK​=ΦK​(ζ^​ℓ​)
  • f(x)→f(Φ(ζ^))f(x)\to f(\Phi(\hat \zeta))f(x)→f(Φ(ζ^​))
  • u(x)→b^(ζ^)u(x)\to \hat b (\hat \zeta)u(x)→b^(ζ^​)
  • ∇u(x)→(DΦ(ζ^))−⊤∇b^(ζ^)\nabla u(x)\to \left(\text{D} \Phi(\hat\zeta)\right)^{-\top}\nabla\hat b(\hat \zeta)∇u(x)→(DΦ(ζ^​))−⊤∇b^(ζ^​)

Example

  • a(u,v)=∫α(x)∇u(x)⋅∇v(x) dx\text a(u,v) = \int \alpha(x)\nabla u(x)\cdot \nabla v(x)~\text{d}xa(u,v)=∫α(x)∇u(x)⋅∇v(x) dx
    [AK]ij=∑ℓ=1Pω^ℓα(Φ(ζ^ℓ))((DΦ(ζ^ℓ))−⊤∇b^i(ζ^ℓ))⋅((DΦ(ζ^ℓ))−⊤∇b^j(ζ^ℓ)) ∣det DΦ(ζ^ℓ)∣ {[A_K]}_{ij} = \sum_{\ell=1}^P\hat\omega_\ell \alpha\left(\Phi(\hat \zeta_\ell)\right)\left(\left(\text{D}\Phi(\hat\zeta_\ell)\right)^{-\top}\nabla \hat b^i(\hat \zeta_\ell)\right)\cdot\left(\left(\text{D}\Phi(\hat \zeta_\ell)\right)^{-\top}\nabla \hat b^j(\hat \zeta_\ell)\right)~|\text{det D}\Phi(\hat \zeta_\ell)| [AK​]ij​=∑ℓ=1P​ω^ℓ​α(Φ(ζ^​ℓ​))((DΦ(ζ^​ℓ​))−⊤∇b^i(ζ^​ℓ​))⋅((DΦ(ζ^​ℓ​))−⊤∇b^j(ζ^​ℓ​)) ∣det DΦ(ζ^​ℓ​)∣

  • ℓ(v)=∫f(x) dx\ell(v) = \int f(x)~\text{d}xℓ(v)=∫f(x) dx
    [ϕ⃗K]i=∑ℓ=1Pω^ℓf(ΦK(ζ^ℓ))b^i(ζ^ℓ) ∣det DΦK(ζ^ℓ)∣ {[\vec \phi_K]_i} = \sum_{\ell=1}^P\hat \omega_\ell f\left(\Phi_K(\hat \zeta_\ell)\right)\hat b^i(\hat \zeta_\ell)~|\text{det D}\Phi_K(\hat\zeta_\ell)| [ϕ​K​]i​=∑ℓ=1P​ω^ℓ​f(ΦK​(ζ^​ℓ​))b^i(ζ^​ℓ​) ∣det DΦK​(ζ^​ℓ​)∣

Lagrangian FEM

Sp0(M)\mathcal S_p^0(\mathcal M)Sp0​(M) : ppp-th Lagrangian finite element space, C0C^0C0 continuity, ppp is the degree of polynomials

  • Multivariate polynomials : Pp(Rd)={x∈Rd→∑α∈N0d,∣α∣≤pcαxα,cα∈R}\mathcal P_p(\R^d) = \{\boldsymbol x\in\R^d\to \sum_{\boldsymbol \alpha\in \N_0^d,|\boldsymbol \alpha|\le p}c_{\boldsymbol \alpha}\boldsymbol x^{\boldsymbol\alpha},c_{\boldsymbol\alpha}\in \R\}Pp​(Rd)={x∈Rd→∑α∈N0d​,∣α∣≤p​cα​xα,cα​∈R}
    • example : P2(R2)=Span{1,x1,x2,x12,x22,x1,x2}\mathcal P_2(\R^2) = \text{Span}\{1,x_1,x_2,x_1^2,x_2^2,x_1,x_2\}P2​(R2)=Span{1,x1​,x2​,x12​,x22​,x1​,x2​}
    • dimension : dimPp(Rd)=(d+pp)\text{dim} \mathcal P_p(\R^d)=\left(\begin{matrix}d+p\\p\end{matrix}\right)dimPp​(Rd)=(d+pp​)
  • Tensor product polynomials : Q(Rd)=Span{x→p1(x1)⋯pd(xd), pi∈Pp(R), i=1,…,d}\mathcal Q(\R^d) = \text{Span}\{x\to p_1(x_1)\cdots p_d(x_d),~p_i\in\mathcal P_p(\R),~i=1,\dots,d\}Q(Rd)=Span{x→p1​(x1​)⋯pd​(xd​), pi​∈Pp​(R), i=1,…,d}
    • example : Q2(R2)=Span{1,x1,x2,x1x2,x12,x12x2,x12x22,x1x22,x22}\mathcal Q_2(\R^2) = \text{Span}\{1,x_1,x_2,x_1x_2,x_1^2,x_1^2x_2,x_1^2x_2^2,x_1x_2^2,x_2^2\}Q2​(R2)=Span{1,x1​,x2​,x1​x2​,x12​,x12​x2​,x12​x22​,x1​x22​,x22​}
    • dimension : dimQp(Rd)=(p+1)d∀p∈N0,d∈N\text{dim}\mathcal Q_p(\R^d) = (p+1)^d\quad \forall p\in\N_0,d\in\NdimQp​(Rd)=(p+1)d∀p∈N0​,d∈N

Convergence and Accuracy

Notation

hMh_\mathcal MhM​ : mesh width hM=max{diam K:K∈M}h_\mathcal M = \text{max}\{\text{diam}~K:K\in \mathcal M\}hM​=max{diam K:K∈M} diam K=max {∣p−q∣:p,q∈K}\text{diam} ~K=\text{max}~\{|\textbf p - \textbf q|:\textbf p,\textbf q\in K\}diam K=max {∣p−q∣:p,q∈K}

Types of Convergence :

  • algebratic convergence : ∥u−uN∥=O(N−α)α>0\Vert u -u_N\Vert = \mathcal O(N^{-\alpha})\quad\alpha >0∥u−uN​∥=O(N−α)α>0
  • exponential convergence : ∥u−uN∥=O(exp(−γNδ))γ,δ>0\Vert u -u_N\Vert = \mathcal O(\text{exp}(-\gamma N^\delta))\quad \gamma,\delta >0∥u−uN​∥=O(exp(−γNδ))γ,δ>0

Concept :

  • Shape Regularity : ρK=hKd∣K∣ρM=maxK∈M ρKhK=diam(K)\rho_K = \frac{h_K^d}{|K|}\quad \rho_\mathcal M = \underset{K\in M}{\text{max}}~\rho_K\quad h_K = \text{diam}(K)ρK​=∣K∣hKd​​ρM​=K∈Mmax​ ρK​hK​=diam(K)

    • diam(K)\text{diam}(K)diam(K) : the longest distance between two points in element KKK
    • ρK/M\rho_{K/\mathcal M}ρK/M​ : shape regularity for element KKK / mesh M\mathcal MM

  • Variational Crime : instead of solve exact varational problem a(uh,vh)=ℓ(vh)\text{a}(u_h,v_h) = \ell(v_h)a(uh​,vh​)=ℓ(vh​), we solve perturbed varational problem a(u~h,vh)=ℓ(vh)\text{a}(\tilde u_h,v_h)=\ell(v_h)a(u~h​,vh​)=ℓ(vh​)

Error Estimation

  • H1H^1H1 norm : infvh∈Sp0(M)∥u−vh∥H1(Ω)≤C(hMp)min{p+1,k}−1∥u∥Hk(Ω)⏟C′N−min{p,k−1}d∥u∥Hk(Ω)\underset{v_h\in \mathcal S_p^0(\mathcal M)}{\text{inf}} \Vert u- v_h\Vert_{H^1(\Omega)}\le \underbrace{C\left(\frac{h_\mathcal M}{p}\right)^{\text{min}\{p+1, k\}-1}\Vert u \Vert_{ H^k(\Omega)}}_{C'N^{-\frac{\text{min}\{p,k-1\}}{d}} \Vert u\Vert_{H^k(\Omega)}}vh​∈Sp0​(M)inf​∥u−vh​∥H1(Ω)​≤C′N−dmin{p,k−1}​∥u∥Hk(Ω)​C(phM​​)min{p+1,k}−1∥u∥Hk(Ω)​​​

    • ∥u−lpu∥H1(Ω)≤ChMmin{p+1,k}−1∥u∥Hk(Ω)\Vert u-\text{l}_p u\Vert _{H^1(\Omega)} \le Ch_\mathcal M^{\text{min}\{p+1,k\}-1}\Vert u\Vert_{H^k(\Omega)}∥u−lp​u∥H1(Ω)​≤ChMmin{p+1,k}−1​∥u∥Hk(Ω)​, lp\text{l}_plp​ is the ppp-th order interpolation

  • L2L^2L2 norm : ∥u−vh∥L2(Ω)/L∞(Ω)=O(hMp+1)\Vert u-v_h\Vert _{L^2(\Omega)/L^\infty(\Omega)} = \mathcal O(h_\mathcal M^{p+1})∥u−vh​∥L2(Ω)/L∞(Ω)​=O(hMp+1​)

    • ∥u−lpu∥L2(Ω)≤ChMmin{p+1,k}∥u∥Hk(Ω)\Vert u-\text{l}_p u\Vert _{L^2(\Omega)} \le Ch_\mathcal M^{\text{min}\{p+1,k\}}\Vert u\Vert_{H^k(\Omega)}∥u−lp​u∥L2(Ω)​≤ChMmin{p+1,k}​∥u∥Hk(Ω)​
    • example : ∥u−l1u∥L2(Ω)≤38hM2∣u∣H2(Ω)\Vert u-\text{l}_1 u\Vert_{L^2(\Omega)}\le \sqrt{\frac{3}{8}}h_\mathcal M^2 |u|_{H^2(\Omega)}∥u−l1​u∥L2(Ω)​≤83​​hM2​∣u∣H2(Ω)​

  • H1H^1H1 seminorm : ∣u−vh∣H1(Ω)=O(hMp)\vert u-v_h\vert _{H^1(\Omega)} = \mathcal O(h_\mathcal M^p)∣u−vh​∣H1(Ω)​=O(hMp​)

    • example : ∣u−l1u∣H1(Ω)≤324ρMhM∣u∣H2(Ω)\vert u-\text{l}_1 u\vert_{H^1(\Omega)}\le \sqrt{\frac{3}{24}}\rho_\mathcal M h_\mathcal M|u|_{H^2(\Omega)}∣u−l1​u∣H1(Ω)​≤243​​ρM​hM​∣u∣H2(Ω)​

Newton’s method

a(u(k),v)+Dua(u(k),v)w=0Dua(u(k),v)=limt→0a(u+tw,v)−a(u,v)tu(k+1)=u(k)+w\begin{aligned} &\text{a}(u^{(k)},v) + \text{D}_u\text{a}(u^{(k)},v)w = 0 \\ &\text{D}_u\text{a}(u^{(k)},v) = \underset{t\to 0 }{\text{lim}}\frac{\text{a}(u+tw,v)-a(u,v)}{t} \\ &u^{(k+1)} = u^{(k)} + w \end{aligned} ​a(u(k),v)+Du​a(u(k),v)w=0Du​a(u(k),v)=t→0lim​ta(u+tw,v)−a(u,v)​u(k+1)=u(k)+w​

Example

  • a(u,v)=∫Ωσ(x)A(∇u)∇u⋅∇v dx\text{a}(u,v)=\int_\Omega \sigma(x)\textbf A(\nabla u)\nabla u \cdot \nabla v~\text{d}xa(u,v)=∫Ω​σ(x)A(∇u)∇u⋅∇v dx

    Dua(u,v)w=limt→0∫Ωσ(x)A(∇u+t∇w)(∇u+t∇w)⋅∇v dx−a(u,v)t=limt→0∫Ωσ(x)(A(∇u)+tDA(∇u)∇w)(∇u+t∇w)⋅∇v dxt=∫ΩA(∇u)∇w⋅∇v+(DA(∇u)∇w)∇u⋅∇v dx\begin{aligned} \text{D}_u \text a(u,v)w &= \underset{t\to 0}{\text{lim}}\frac{\int_{\Omega}\sigma(x)\textbf A(\nabla u + t\nabla w)(\nabla u + t\nabla w) \cdot \nabla v~\text{d}x - a(u,v)}{t} \\ &= \underset{t\to 0}{\text{lim}}\frac{\int_{\Omega}\sigma(x)\left(\textbf A(\nabla u)+ t\text{D}\textbf A(\nabla u)\nabla w\right)(\nabla u + t\nabla w) \cdot \nabla v~\text{d}x}{t} \\ &= \int_\Omega \textbf A(\nabla u) \nabla w\cdot \nabla v + (\text D\textbf A(\nabla u)\nabla w)\nabla u \cdot \nabla v~\text{d}x \end{aligned}Du​a(u,v)w​=t→0lim​t∫Ω​σ(x)A(∇u+t∇w)(∇u+t∇w)⋅∇v dx−a(u,v)​=t→0lim​t∫Ω​σ(x)(A(∇u)+tDA(∇u)∇w)(∇u+t∇w)⋅∇v dx​=∫Ω​A(∇u)∇w⋅∇v+(DA(∇u)∇w)∇u⋅∇v dx​

Linear

Mdμ⃗(t)dt+Aμ⃗(t)=ϕ⃗(t)\textbf M\frac{\text d \vec \mu(t)}{\text dt} + \textbf A\vec \mu(t) = \vec \phi(t) Mdtdμ​(t)​+Aμ​(t)=ϕ​(t)

Notation

  • M∈RN×N\textbf M\in \R^{N\times N}M∈RN×N : mass matrix Mij=m(bhj,bhi)\textbf M_{ij}=\text{m}(b_h^j,b_h^i)Mij​=m(bhj​,bhi​)
  • A∈RN×N\textbf{A} \in \R^{N\times N}A∈RN×N : stiffness matrix Aij=a(bhj,bhi)\textbf A_{ij} = \text{a}(b_h^j,b_h^i)Aij​=a(bhj​,bhi​)
  • ϕ⃗∈RN\vec \phi \in \R^Nϕ​∈RN : load vector ϕ⃗i(t)=ℓ(t)(bhi)\vec\phi_i(t) = \ell(t)(b_h^i)ϕ​i​(t)=ℓ(t)(bhi​)

Runge-Kutta

u˙=f(t,u)\dot{\textbf u} = \textbf f(t,\textbf u) u˙=f(t,u)

Mμ⃗˙+Aμ⃗(t)=ϕ⃗(t)⇒μ⃗˙=M−1(ϕ⃗(t)−Aμ⃗(t))⏟f(t,μ⃗)\textbf M\dot{\vec \mu} + \textbf A\vec \mu(t) = \vec \phi(t) \Rightarrow \dot{\vec \mu} = \underbrace{\textbf M^{-1}(\vec\phi(t)-\textbf A\vec \mu(t))}_{\textbf f(t,\vec \mu)} Mμ​˙​+Aμ​(t)=ϕ​(t)⇒μ​˙​=f(t,μ​)M−1(ϕ​(t)−Aμ​(t))​​

Mμ⃗(j+1)−2μ⃗(j)+μ⃗(j−1)τ2=−14A(μ⃗(j−1)+2μ⃗(i)+μ⃗(j+1))+12(ϕ⃗(tj−τ2)+ϕ⃗(tj+τ2))\textbf M\frac{\vec \mu^{(j+1)}-2\vec \mu^{(j)}+\vec \mu^{(j-1)}}{\tau^2} = -\frac{1}{4}\textbf A\left(\vec \mu^{(j-1)}+2\vec \mu^{(i)}+\vec \mu^{(j+1)}\right) + \frac{1}{2}\left(\vec\phi(t_j - \frac{\tau}{2})+\vec\phi(t_j +\frac{\tau}{2})\right) Mτ2μ​(j+1)−2μ​(j)+μ​(j−1)​=−41​A(μ​(j−1)+2μ​(i)+μ​(j+1))+21​(ϕ​(tj​−2τ​)+ϕ​(tj​+2τ​))

Störmer-Verlet

Mμ⃗(j+1)−2μ⃗(j)+μ⃗(j−1)τ2=−Aμ⃗(j)+ϕ⃗(tj)\textbf M\frac{\vec \mu^{(j+1)}-2\vec \mu^{(j)}+\vec \mu^{(j-1)}}{\tau^2} = -\textbf A\vec \mu^{(j)} +\vec\phi(t_j) Mτ2μ​(j+1)−2μ​(j)+μ​(j−1)​=−Aμ​(j)+ϕ​(tj​)

Leapfrog

Mν⃗(j+12)−ν⃗(j−12)τ=−Aμ⃗(j)+ϕ⃗(tj)μ⃗(j+1)−μ⃗(j)τ=ν⃗(j+12)\begin{aligned} \textbf M\frac{\vec \nu^{(j+\frac{1}{2})}-\vec \nu^{(j-\frac{1}{2})}}{\tau} &= -\textbf A\vec \mu^{(j)} + \vec\phi(t_j) \\ \frac{\vec \mu^{(j+1)}-\vec \mu^{(j)}}{\tau} &= \vec\nu^{(j+\frac{1}{2})} \end{aligned} Mτν(j+21​)−ν(j−21​)​τμ​(j+1)−μ​(j)​​=−Aμ​(j)+ϕ​(tj​)=ν(j+21​)​

τ∑j=1M∥u−uh∥H12≤C(hMp+τ2)τ∑j=1M∥u−uh∥L22≤C(hMp+1+τ2)\begin{aligned} \sqrt{\tau\sum_{j=1}^M\Vert u-u_h\Vert^2_{H^1}}&\le C(h_\mathcal M^p + \tau^2) \\ \sqrt{\tau\sum_{j=1}^M\Vert u-u_h\Vert^2_{L^2}}&\le C(h_\mathcal M^{p+1} + \tau^2) \end{aligned} τj=1∑M​∥u−uh​∥H12​​τj=1∑M​∥u−uh​∥L22​​​≤C(hMp​+τ2)≤C(hMp+1​+τ2)​

stability for leapfrog timestepping entails : τ≤O(hM)\tau\le \mathcal O(h_\mathcal M)τ≤O(hM​)

Method of Lines

discrete variables other than time, then solve the equation as ODE

Courant-Fridrichs-Lewy(CFL) condition

maximum speed of propagation : s=sup{∣f′(ζ)∣:inf u0(x)≤ζ≤sup u0(x)}s= \text{sup}\{|f'(\zeta)|:\text{inf}~u_0(x)\le \zeta\le \text{sup}~u_0(x)\}s=sup{∣f′(ζ)∣:inf u0​(x)≤ζ≤sup u0​(x)}

minimum timestep : τ≤hs\tau \le \frac{h}{s}τ≤sh​

DoD Domain of Dependency

CFL-condition⇔analytical DoD⊂numerical DoD\text{CFL-condition}\Leftrightarrow \text{analytical DoD}\subset \text{numerical DoD} CFL-condition⇔analytical DoD⊂numerical DoD

Example : Störmer-Verlet timestepping

Convection Diffusion

Heat conduction in a fluid

  • CDE (Convection-Diffusion Equation) : −∇⋅(κ∇u(x))⏟diffusive term(2nd order)+∇⋅(ρv(x)u(x))⏟convective term(1st order)=f\underbrace{-\nabla\cdot(\kappa \nabla u(\boldsymbol x))}_{\text{diffusive term(2nd order)}}+\underbrace{\nabla\cdot (\rho\textbf v(\boldsymbol x)u(\boldsymbol x))}_{\text{convective term(1st order)}} = fdiffusive term(2nd order)−∇⋅(κ∇u(x))​​+convective term(1st order)∇⋅(ρv(x)u(x))​​=f
  • Incompressible CDE : −κ∇2u⏟diffusive term(2nd order)+ρv⋅∇u⏟convective term(1st order)=f\underbrace{-\kappa\nabla^2 u}_{\text{diffusive term(2nd order)}} + \underbrace{\rho\textbf v\cdot \nabla u}_{\text{convective term(1st order)}} = fdiffusive term(2nd order)−κ∇2u​​+convective term(1st order)ρv⋅∇u​​=f
  • Time-Depdent(Transient) Heat Flow : ∂(ρu)∂t−κ∇2u+ρv(x,t)⋅∇u=f(x,t)\frac{\partial (\rho u)}{\partial t} -\kappa\nabla^2u+\rho \textbf v(\boldsymbol x,t)\cdot \nabla u =f(\boldsymbol x,t)∂t∂(ρu)​−κ∇2u+ρv(x,t)⋅∇u=f(x,t)
  • Transport Equation : ∂u∂t+v(x,t)⋅∇u=f(x)\frac{\partial u}{\partial t} +\textbf v(\boldsymbol x,t)\cdot\nabla u = f(\boldsymbol x)∂t∂u​+v(x,t)⋅∇u=f(x)

Notation

  • u∈Ru\in \Ru∈R : temperature
  • v∈Rd\textbf v\in \R^dv∈Rd : fluid velocity

Maximumm principle

−∇2u+v⋅∇u≥0⇒minx∈∂Ω u(x)=minx∈Ω u(x)−∇2u+v⋅∇u≤0⇒maxx∈∂Ω u(x)=maxx∈Ω u(x)\begin{aligned} -\nabla^2 u +\textbf v\cdot\nabla u &\ge 0 \Rightarrow \underset{x\in\partial\Omega}{\text{min}}~u(x)=\underset{x\in\Omega}{\text{min}}~u(x) \\ -\nabla^2 u +\textbf v\cdot\nabla u &\le 0 \Rightarrow \underset{x\in\partial\Omega}{\text{max}}~u(x)=\underset{x\in\Omega}{\text{max}}~u(x) \end{aligned} −∇2u+v⋅∇u−∇2u+v⋅∇u​≥0⇒x∈∂Ωmin​ u(x)=x∈Ωmin​ u(x)≤0⇒x∈∂Ωmax​ u(x)=x∈Ωmax​ u(x)​

Boundary

  • inflow boundary : Γin={x∈∂Ω,v(x)⋅n(x)<0}\Gamma_{\text{in}} = \{x\in\partial\Omega, \textbf v(\boldsymbol x)\cdot \boldsymbol n(\boldsymbol x) < 0\}Γin​={x∈∂Ω,v(x)⋅n(x)<0}
  • outflow boundary : Γout={x∈∂Ω,v(x)⋅n(x)>0}\Gamma_{\text{out}} = \{x\in\partial\Omega, \textbf v(\boldsymbol x)\cdot \boldsymbol n(\boldsymbol x) > 0\}Γout​={x∈∂Ω,v(x)⋅n(x)>0}

Method of Lines

discretized d−1d-1d−1 dimension

∂u∂t−ϵ∇2u+v(x,t)⋅∇u=f⇓Mdμ⃗dt(t)+ϵAμ⃗(t)+B(t)μ⃗(t)=ϕ⃗(t)\frac{\partial u }{\partial t} - \epsilon \nabla^2u +\textbf v(\boldsymbol x, t)\cdot \nabla u = f \\ \Downarrow \\ \textbf M \frac{\text d\vec \mu }{\text d t}(t) + \epsilon \textbf A\vec \mu(t) + \textbf B(t)\vec\mu(t) =\vec\phi (t) ∂t∂u​−ϵ∇2u+v(x,t)⋅∇u=f⇓Mdtdμ​​(t)+ϵAμ​(t)+B(t)μ​(t)=ϕ​(t)

Notation

  • μ⃗(t)∈RN\vec \mu(t)\in \R^Nμ​(t)∈RN : approximation of uhu_huh​
  • M∈RN×N\textbf M\in\R^{N\times N}M∈RN×N : mass matrix
  • A∈RN×N\textbf A\in \R^{N\times N}A∈RN×N : Galerkin matirx
  • B(t)∈RN×N\textbf B(t)\in \R^{N\times N}B(t)∈RN×N : time-dependent matrix for convection term
  • ϕ⃗(t)∈RN\vec \phi(t)\in\R^Nϕ​(t)∈RN : load function fff and boundary ggg

Upwind

−ϵ∇2u+v⋅∇u=f-\epsilon \nabla^2 u + \textbf v\cdot \nabla u = f −ϵ∇2u+v⋅∇u=f

for very small κ/ϵ\kappa/\epsilonκ/ϵ spurious oscillation is observed

  • upwind quadrature ζ→limδ→0 ζ−δv(ζ)\zeta\to \underset{\delta\to 0}{\text{lim}}~\zeta - \delta \textbf v(\zeta)ζ→δ→0lim​ ζ−δv(ζ)

    • convergence : ∥u−uh∥L2=O(hM)\Vert u-u_h\Vert_{L^2} = \mathcal O(h_M)∥u−uh​∥L2​=O(hM​)

  • streamline-diffusion method : ϵ→ϵI+δKvKvK⊤\epsilon \to \epsilon\textbf I + \delta_K \textbf v_K \textbf v_K^\topϵ→ϵI+δK​vK​vK⊤​

    • consistency (SUPG stremaline upwind/petrov galerkin method) :

      ∫Ω∇u⋅∇w+(v(x)⋅∇u)w dx+∑K∈MδK∫K(−ϵ∇2u+v⋅∇u−f)⋅(v⋅∇w)dx⏟stabilization term=∫Ωfwdx\int_\Omega \nabla u\cdot\nabla w+(\textbf v(x)\cdot\nabla u)w~\text d \boldsymbol x + \underbrace{\sum_{K\in\mathcal M}\delta_K\int_K(-\epsilon\nabla^2 u +\textbf v\cdot \nabla u -f)\cdot(\textbf v\cdot \nabla w)\text d\boldsymbol x}_{\text{stabilization term}} = \int_\Omega fw\text d\boldsymbol x ∫Ω​∇u⋅∇w+(v(x)⋅∇u)w dx+stabilization termK∈M∑​δK​∫K​(−ϵ∇2u+v⋅∇u−f)⋅(v⋅∇w)dx​​=∫Ω​fwdx

    • convergence : ∥u−uh∥L2=O(hM2)\Vert u-u_h\Vert_{L^2} = \mathcal O(h_\mathcal M^2)∥u−uh​∥L2​=O(hM2​)

other methods :

  • forward differential : ∣ϵh−1∣≥1|\epsilon h^{-1}|\ge 1∣ϵh−1∣≥1

    dudx∣x=xi=ui+1−uih\frac{\text d u}{\text d x}|_{x=x_i} = \frac{u_{i+1}-u_{i}}{h} dxdu​∣x=xi​​=hui+1​−ui​​

  • backward differential : ϵ≥0,h>0\epsilon \ge 0, h>0ϵ≥0,h>0

    dudx∣x=xi=ui−ui−1h\frac{\text d u}{\text d x}|_{x=x_i} = \frac{u_i-u_{i-1}}{h} dxdu​∣x=xi​​=hui​−ui−1​​

Strang Splitting

y˙=g(t,y)+r(t,y)\dot {\textbf y} = g(t,\textbf y)+r(t,\textbf y) y˙​=g(t,y)+r(t,y)

  1. y~=z(tj−1,12τ)z˙=g(t,z)z(tj−1)=y(j−1)\tilde {\textbf y} = \textbf z(t_{j-1},\frac{1}{2}\tau)\quad \dot{\textbf z}=g(t,\textbf z)\quad \textbf z(t_{j-1})=y^{(j-1)}y~​=z(tj−1​,21​τ)z˙=g(t,z)z(tj−1​)=y(j−1)
  2. y^=w(tj)w˙=r(t,w)w(tj−1)=y~\hat{\textbf y} = \textbf w(t_j)\quad \dot {\textbf w} = \textbf r(t,\textbf w)\quad \textbf w(t_{j-1})=\tilde yy^​=w(tj​)w˙=r(t,w)w(tj−1​)=y~​
  3. y(j)=z(tj)z˙=g(t,z)z(tj−1+12τ)=y^\textbf y^{(j)} = \textbf z(t_j)\quad \dot {\textbf z}=\textbf g(t,\textbf z)\quad \textbf z(t_{j-1}+\frac{1}{2}\tau)=\hat{\textbf y}y(j)=z(tj​)z˙=g(t,z)z(tj−1​+21​τ)=y^​

Reimann problem

u0={ul∈Rx<0ur∈Rx>0u_0 = \begin{cases} u_l \in\R & x <0 \\ u_r \in\R & x > 0 \end{cases} u0​={ul​∈Rur​∈R​x<0x>0​

shock solution

u(x,t)={ulx<s˙turx>s˙ts˙=f(ul)−f(ur)ul−uru(x,t) = \begin{cases} u_l & x < \dot s t\\ u_r & x > \dot s t \end{cases} \quad \dot s = \frac{f(u_l) - f(u_r)}{u_l-u_r} u(x,t)={ul​ur​​x<s˙tx>s˙t​s˙=ul​−ur​f(ul​)−f(ur​)​

rarefaction sollution

f∈C2(R)f\in C^2(\R)f∈C2(R) is strictly {convex and ul<urconcave and ur<ul\begin{cases}\text{convex and } u_l<u_r\\\text{concave and }u_r < u_l\end{cases}{convex and ul​<ur​concave and ur​<ul​​

u(x,t)={ulx<min{f′(ul),f′(ur)}⋅tg(xt)min{f′(ul),f′(ur)}<xt<max{f′(ul),f′(ur)}urx>max{f′(ul),f′(ur)}⋅tg=(f′)−1\begin{aligned} u(x,t) &= \begin{cases} u_l & x<\text{min}\{f'(u_l),f'(u_r)\}\cdot t \\ g(\frac{x}{t}) & \text{min}\{f'(u_l),f'(u_r)\}<\frac{x}{t}<\text{max}\{f'(u_l),f'(u_r)\}\\ u_r & x>\text{max}\{f'(u_l),f'(u_r)\}\cdot t \end{cases} \\ g &= (f')^{-1} \end{aligned} u(x,t)g​=⎩⎨⎧​ul​g(tx​)ur​​x<min{f′(ul​),f′(ur​)}⋅tmin{f′(ul​),f′(ur​)}<tx​<max{f′(ul​),f′(ur​)}x>max{f′(ul​),f′(ur​)}⋅t​=(f′)−1​

Numerical Flux

  • Center Flux : F1(v,w)=12(f(v)+f(w))F2(v,w)=f(12(v+w))F_1(v,w) = \frac{1}{2}(f(v)+f(w)) \quad F_2(v,w)=f\left(\frac{1}{2}(v+w)\right)F1​(v,w)=21​(f(v)+f(w))F2​(v,w)=f(21​(v+w))
  • La_Friedrichs/Rusanov Flus : F(v,w)=12(f(v)+f(w))−12(w−v)F(v,w) = \frac{1}{2}(f(v)+f(w))-\frac{1}{2}(w-v)F(v,w)=21​(f(v)+f(w))−21​(w−v)
  • Upwind Flux : F(w,v)={f(v)s˙≥0f(w)s˙<0s˙={f(w)−f(v)w−vv≠wf′(v)v=wF(w,v) = \begin{cases} f(v) & \dot s \ge 0\\ f(w) & \dot s < 0 \end{cases} \quad \dot s =\begin{cases} \frac{f(w)-f(v)}{w-v}&v\neq w \\ f'(v)&v=w \end{cases}F(w,v)={f(v)f(w)​s˙≥0s˙<0​s˙={w−vf(w)−f(v)​f′(v)​v=wv=w​
  • Godunov Flux : u^{\downarrow} = \begin{cases} w & \begin{cases} &v = w\\ &v > w\and \dot s < 0\\ &v < w \and f'(w) < 0\end{cases} &\begin{aligned} &\text{constant solution}\\ &\text{subsonic shock}\\ &\text{subsonic rarefaction} \end{aligned} \\ v & \begin{cases} &v > w \and \dot s > 0 \\ &v < w \and f'(v) > 0 \end{cases} &\begin{aligned} &\text{supersonic shock}\\ &\text{supersonic rarefaction}\\ \end{aligned} \\ (f')^{-1}(0) & v < w \and f'(v) \le 0\le f'(w) & \text{transonic rarefaction} \end{cases}\quad F(v,w)=f(u^\downarrow(v,w))

LerhFEM++

double result;
if (v >= w) result = std::max(f(v), f(w));
else if(f.derivative(v) > 0.0) result = f(v);
else if(f.derivative(w) < 0.0) result = f(w);
else{
    auto df = [this](double  x){return f.derivative;};
    double z = findRoots(v, w, df);
    result =  f(z);
}
